intro: Commiphora hereroensis, commonly known as the Herero myrrh tree, is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and small, alternate leaves. It produces a resinous sap that has been traditionally used for medicinal and aromatic purposes. The species is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
